Description: Small vase with pointed base, ovoid body tapering to a short neck and everted rim, made of straw tempered Nile silt pottery.
Curator's comments: Marked " 874" and bears label: "from the tombs at Ballas in Upper Egypt, between the VI and XI dynasties". (This was erroneous dating of Predynastic material). Presented by Prof. F. Petrie". Like Rough ware R69c in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Augustus Henry Lane Fox Pitt-Rivers
